article.headline: UAB improves tourney credentials
article.linkText: Marquette's tourney hopes fade, UAB's brighten
article.story: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) -- Mo Finley scored 20 points to help UAB overcome a slow start to defeat Marquette 87-69 on Saturday. Sidney Ball added 12 points and Donnell Taylor had 10 for UAB (17-8, 10-4 Conference USA). Travis Diener scored 17 points to lead Marquette (15-10, 6-8). Scott Merritt added 12 and Terry Sanders had 10 for the Golden eagles. UAB celebrated the 25th anniversary of its men's basketball program, introducing former players, coaches, managers and trainers in a halftime ceremony. But it looked early like Marquette would be the team celebrating. Diener, who leads Conference USA in scoring and assists, hit two 3-pointers to help the Golden Eagles to a 14-2 lead in the opening minutes. But UAB used its trademark depth and pressure defense to come back. Sparked by their second unit, the Blazers went on an 18-6 run to tie the game 20-all with 4:38 left in the first half. Marques Lewis scored 6 points inside and Tony Johnson had a steal and dunk to spark the run. Taylor hit a 3 to make it 23-20, and UAB never trailed again. UAB led 34-28 at halftime, and Finley hit three 3-pointers early in the second half to give the Blazers control.
